passages.text: Transportation | Shipping
Nordic American Tanker Shipping Ltd. NAT | \(3.06\) In Line | Target Price/Base Case: \(2.5\) Change in Earnings Forecast
Market Capitalization (M)$552Shares Outstanding (M)211Debt/Total Capital34.6%Dividend/Distribution Yield13.1%Enterprise Value (M)$77052-Week Range$2.13 - $3.83Fiscal Year EndDec
1 Year Price History
Nordic American Tanker Shipping Ltd.54321008/2411/2402/2505/2508/25Source: FactSet

If You Can't Pay Dividends with Earnings, Just Use (More) Debt!NAT posted an adjusted 2Q25 loss of \(0.04 / share\), coming in well below our forecast of a \(0.10 / share profit and the average Street estimate of a\) 0.02/share gain. Although most line items fell short of our projections (with operating expenses and D&A both coming in nearly \(2 million higher than the prior quarter), the biggest attribute to the large earnings miss was the top line, where both spot TCE rates and operating days were largely off the mark. Indeed, NAT's 2Q TCE rate of \(26,880 / day was more than 20\% below that of the most comparable public Suezmax fleet (TNK), with estimated off- hire days associated with drydocking days totaling more than 370 days, bringing year- to- date off- hire days to above 500 days (or 25 days per vessel in just the first 6 months of the year...a shockingly high total for a fleet constantly noted as "top quality"). NAT declared a \(0.10 / share dividend for 2Q, clearly substantially higher than the adjusted earnings (and even the breakeven EPS including a gain on vessel sale), marking the third consecutive quarter (and 7th of the last 8) where the dividend exceeded EPS. Year to date, NAT has spent\) 89 million on fleet upgrades (net of asset sales), yet has added \(174 million of debt, with more than one- third of the\) 85 million difference being used to pay a dividend that is not being earned. Maybe this strategy "works" until the tanker market begins a strong cyclical upturn (though we note that in the much stronger rate environment we forecast for 2026, our new EPS estimate is only \(0.23), but for now it appears investors have figured out the disconnect, with NAT continuing to underperform its crude tanker peers. We retain our In Line rating and\) 2.50 price target.

Please see the analyst certification and important disclosures on page 6 of this report. Evercore ISI and affiliates do and seek to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.
Figure 1. NAT Income Statement
Source: Company data, Evercore ISI Research
Figure 2. NAT Balance Sheet
Source: Company data, Evercore ISI Research
Figure 3. NAT Cash Flow Statement
Source: Company data, Evercore ISI Research
We arrive at our 12- month price target of \(\) 2.50\(for NAT by applying a 7.0x multiple to our 2025 EBITDA estimate.\)

We would have a more favorable view on NAT shares if spot rates exceed our forecasts materially. Given NAT's \(70\%\) spot market exposure it has perceived earnings and dividend leverage to strength in rates, and rate upside could quickly enhance the potential dividend yield, and thus total return potential, of the shares. We would also have a more optimistic outlook on the stock if NAT times further fleet expansion well with a market recovery. We would have a less favorable view on the stock spot rates reversed recent strength, forcing NAT to continue to issue shares or debt to fund a dividend not covered by cash flow.

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
